name: 10 Steps Ahead
description:
A turn-based puzzle game where the player (the grey floating ball) has to survive for as many turns as they can before being hit by an attack from the pole in the middle; each step you take causes the pole to activate its bottom layer and move the other layers down.

The barriers between the pole and the player can be used to defend against attacks, although they collapse after a few hits. Strategy revolves around anticipating the enemy's actions - the next 10 of them can be seen at all times - and moving in a way that makes as efficient use of the barriers as possible.

Try to stay in the game as long as you can and you might end up on the global leaderboard!

------------

Controls
A/D to move
SPACE to use a powerup
W/S to swap between powerups

A detailed description of layers and powerups can be found here.

------------

If you'd like, you can view the game's code on its Github page.
